description.p: You replace the wizard’s spellbook with tattoos etched upon your body. These living etchings serve as your grimoire. When you prepare wizard spells, the tattoos on your body shift and realign, glowing faintly with arcane light.

When you find a spell, you can inscribe it onto your skin by spending 2 hours and 25 gp per level of the spell. If your tattoos are ever destroyed, you can recreate them during a long rest at the same cost and time as replacing a lost spellbook.

sheet.description: Inscribing a spell onto your body as a tattoo costs 2 hours and 25 gp per spell level. Destroyed tattoos can be recreated during a long rest at the same cost and time as a lost spellbook.

description.p: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to inscribe a magical tattoo onto one willing creature other than yourself at the end of a long rest. The tattoo remains until you finish your next long rest.
As a bonus action, the creature can activate the tattoo, causing it to flare with arcane power for 1 minute. Choose one of the following tattoos when you inscribe it:

ul.li: Ward of Ink. The creature gains a +2 bonus to AC.
Strike of Ink. Once per turn, when the creature hits with a weapon attack, it deals extra damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Glyph of Vigor. At the start of each of its turns, the creature gains temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.

description.p: Once activated, the tattoo’s magic is expended when the effect ends, and the tattoo fades. A creature can’t benefit from more than one Shared Ink tattoo at a time.

sheet.description: At the end of a long rest, inscribe a magical tattoo on one willing creature (not yourself). The creature can activate it as a bonus action to gain one of three effects for 1 minute: +2 AC, extra weapon damage equal to your Int modifier, or temporary hit points equal to your Int modifier each turn. Only one Shared Ink tattoo can affect a creature at a time.

description.p: Your tattoos pulse with arcane energy, allowing you to slip away when danger strikes. When you take damage from a creature you can see, you can use your reaction to teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Ink Trail. When you use Ink Step, you leave behind a faint trail of swirling ink in your previous space until the start of your next turn. This area counts as lightly obscured for creatures within 5 feet, granting them disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you take damage from a creature you can see, you can teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space. Ink Trail creates lightly obscured terrain in your previous space for 1 turn. Uses per long rest equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1).
